meanings.definition: To set a price in advance.
meanings.sent1: She always prepricings her handmade crafts before selling them at the market.
meanings.sent2: The store decided to prepricing their new products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prepricings its acorns for the winter, hoping for a good return on investment.
meanings.sent4: The farmer prepricings the harvest, carefully calculating the costs and profits.
meanings.sent5: By prepricing the concert tickets, the organizers ensured a smooth ticketing process.

meanings.definition: The act of determining a price before an item is sold.
meanings.sent1: The prepricing of the antique vase was done by the expert appraiser.
meanings.sent2: Before the auction, the prepricing of the items took place to set starting bids.
meanings.sent3: The prepricing of the rare painting caused quite a stir among art collectors.
meanings.sent4: The prepricing of the limited edition sneakers made them highly sought after.
meanings.sent5: The prepricing of the car was crucial for the success of the dealership's sales event.
